abstract: Clearwire, the wireless broadband company founded by the cellphone pioneer Craig O. McCaw, raised $600 million late Wednesday in its initial public offering, which priced at the top end of the expected range. Shares of the company, whose backers include Motorola and Intel, begin trading Thursday.
lead_paragraph: Clearwire, the wireless broadband company founded by the cellphone pioneer Craig O. McCaw, raised $600 million late Wednesday in its initial public offering, which priced at the top end of the expected range. Shares of the company, whose backers include Motorola and Intel, begin trading Thursday.
